articles.title: Kim Jong Il Pays Unofficial Visit to China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Pays Unofficial Visit to China
						
Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il paid an unofficial visit to the People's Republic of China from August 26 to 30 at the invitation of Hu JIntao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and president of the PRC.
					 He was accompanied by Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the NDC and minister of the People's Armed forces of the DPRK, Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Thae Jong Su, department director of the C.C., the WPK, Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Jang Song Thaek, Hong Sok Hyong, Kim Yong Il and Kim Yang Gon who are department directors of the C.C., the WPK, Choe Ryong Hae, chief secretary of the North Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the WPK, Kim Phyong Hae, chief secretary of the North Phyongan Provincial Committee of the WPK, and Pak To Chun, chief secretary of the Jagang Provincial Committee of the WPK.
					
					 The party and state leaders and people of China warmly welcomed Kim Jong Il, who visited China again, and accorded with utmost sincerity cordial hospitality to him.
					
					 Kim Jong Il had cordial meeting and talks with Hu Jintao in Changchun City on August 27.
					
					 Present there from the Chinese side were Ling Jihua, member of the Secretariat of the CPC Central Committee and director of the General Office of the CPC Central Committee, Dai Bingguo, state councilor, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, and Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.  
					
					 Hu Jintao warmly welcomed Kim Jong Il's China visit on behalf of the party, government and people of China and said that his visit to Jilin Province and Heilongjiang Province, where the historical roots of Sino-DPRK friendship were provided amid the common struggle against foreign aggressors, is of particular importance in boosting the traditional bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation onto a new higher stage.
					
					 The China visit paid by Kim Jong Il four months after his last visit in May is a clear testimony proving what great importance he attaches to the traditional DPRK-China friendship provided by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries, Hu said, highly appreciating the devoted service rendered by Kim Jong Il for the steady development of the bilateral friendship.
					
					 Kim Jong Il said that he was very pleased to meet Hu Jintao four months after, expressing deep thanks to him for sparing his precious time to come to Changchun far away from the capital to kindly receive him and according cordial hospitality to him.
					
					 The top leaders of the two parties and the two countries informed each other of the situations in their countries and had a frank exchange of views on boosting the relations between the two parties and the two countries and on important international and regional issues of common concern in a comradely, sincere and friendly atmosphere and reached a full consensus of views.
					
					 Hu said that the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship is a precious treasure of the two parties and the two peoples and it is the common historic responsibility of the two sides to advance the friendship along with the times and convey it down through generations to come, reiterating the steadfast policy of the Chinese party and government to boost the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation.
					
					 Every part of the northeastern region of China is closely associated with the footprints of revolution left by President Kim Il Sung, Hu said, adding that the President not only achieved the independence of Korea through a protracted struggle but made a great contribution to the victory of the Chinese revolution.
					
					 Stronger Sino-DPRK cooperation is favorable for stepping up socialist construction in the two countries and firmly defending and promoting common interests of the two sides and regional peace, stability and prosperity, Hu said.
					
					 The Chinese side sincerely wishes to preserve and develop the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation together with the Korean side, Hu said, reiterating his intention to inject fresh dynamism and vitality into the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship and give momentum to the bilateral ties of good-neighborliness, friendship and cooperation and develop them in depth so as to bring bigger happiness to the two countries and the two peoples and make a greater contribution to peace, stability and prosperity and development in Northeast Asia and, furthermore, the rest of the world.
					
					 The long-standing DPRK-China friendship will last long no matter how much water may flow under the bridge and how often a generation is replaced by another as it is the friendship that stood tempest and trials of history, Kim Jong Il said, reiterating the invariable will and determination of the party and government of the DPRK to boost the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation.
					
					 The northeastern region of China is an unforgettable area where President Kim Il Sung waged an arduous revolutionary struggle for over 20 years joining hands with the revolutionaries and people of China, drinking water in the region and breathing air there, Kim Jong Il said, adding that the President always remembered the mountains and fields of the northeastern region of China dear to him and the Chinese comrades who fought alongside him.
					
					 Kim Jong Il said that he was deeply impressed to see the northeastern region of China developing and undergoing changes with each passing day during his visit, adding that this signal turn is a clear proof of the validity and vitality of the strategy set forth by the party and government of China to develop its northeastern region.
					
					 It was estimated at the talks that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and the two countries have further developed in the idea of socialism after several historic meetings between the top leaders of the two countries in recent years. The talks expressed mutual support and firm solidarity with the two parties and the two countries in their struggle for socialist construction and national reunification.
					
					 Hu highly appreciated the positive measures taken by the DPRK to preserve the stability, develop economy and improve the standard of people's living and sincerely wished the Korean people greater successes in the cause of nation-building under the leadership of the WPK headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Hu also extended support to the party and people of the DPRK in their efforts to maintain the orientation of the development of socialism and the Korean comrades exploring the road of development suited to the specific conditions of the country, expressing the belief that the whole party and the country will work hard in close unity and achieve fresh successes in the struggle to build a thriving nation without fail under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed his conviction that the Chinese people would steadily win fresh great victories in their historic course of strengthening the party's ability of governance, establishing a scientific outlook on development and building a harmonious society under the leadership of the CPC with Hu Jintao as general secretary.
					
					 Both sides had frank and sincere exchange of views on international and regional issues of mutual concern, the situation in Northeast Asia, in particular, and reached a full consensus of views.
					
					 Hu Jintao hosted a grand banquet in honor of Kim Jong Il on a visit to China at the Nanhu State Guesthouse in Changchun City in the evening on August 27.
					
					 Present at the banquet on invitation were Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Thae Jong Su, Kang Sok Ju, Jang Song Thaek, Hong Sok Hyong, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Phyong Hae, Pak To Chun and other suite members and DPRK Ambassador to China Choe Pyong Gwan.
					
					 Present there were Ling Jihua, Dai Bingguo, Wang Jiarui, Yang Jiechi, Zhang Ping, Chen Deming, Liu Zhijun, minister of Railways, Liu Jieyi, Liu Hongcai, Sun Zhengcai, secretary of the Jilin Provincial Committee of the CPC, Wang Yulin, governor of Jilin Province, Gao Guangbin, secretary of the Changchun City Committee of the CPC, and other leading officials from Beijing and localities.
					
					 Hu Jintao and Kim Jong Il made speeches there.
					
					 An art performance specially prepared by Chinese artistes was given in welcome of Kim Jong Il at the Nanhu State Guesthouse Theatre, Changchun on the same day.
					
					 Kim Jong Il appreciated the performance together with Hu Jintao.
					
					 He conveyed a floral basket in congratulation of the successful performance of the artistes.
					
					 Hu bid warm farewell to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited several cities in Jilin and Heilongjiang provinces of China for five days and received sincere and warm welcome from Chinese people everywhere he went.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited Jilin City associated with the revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He was greeted at Jilin Railway Station by Dai Bingguo, Wang Jiarui, Liu Zhijun, Liu Hongcai, Sun Zhengcai, Chen Weigen, deputy governor of the Jilin Province, and other officials from Beijing and local areas. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il met and had a friendly talk with Dai Bingguo.
					
					 Noting that Hu Jintao, attaching utmost importance to the Sino-DPRK friendship, sent him to Jilin to accord special reception to Kim Jong Il, Dai Bingguo warmly welcomed his China visit on behalf of Hu Jintao, the Central Committee of the CPC and the State Council of the PRC. 
					
					 Dai Bingguo said that General Secretary Kim Jong Il's China visit marks a historic event which recorded a shining chapter in the strengthening the Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					 Dai noted that the Chinese people are rejoiced as over their own over many achievements made by the Korean people in the drive to accomplish the cause of building a thriving nation and various other fields under the leadership of Kim Jong Il and sincerely congratulate them on their achievements.
					
					 Saying that the collective leadership including General Secretary Hu Jintao is attaching great importance to the Sino-DPRK friendship, Dai reiterated the steadfast stand of the Chinese party and government to steadily consolidate the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, conducted by Dai Bingguo and other senior officials of Beijing and local areas, toured various places of Jilin.
					
					 The first leg of his visit was Jilin Yuwen Middle School where President Kim Il Sung studied from 1927 to 1929.
					
					 Upon arriving at the school amid the warm welcome of its teachers and students, Kim Jong Il laid a floral basket before the statue of the President at the school and paid high tribute to him before going round the interior of the school preserved to its original state.
					
					 Seeing in profound reverence precious historic relics such as a desk and a chair associated with the noble personality of the President during his school days more than 80 years ago, Kim Jong Il was overcome with deep emotion.
					
					 The student chorus of the school presented to Kim Jong Il visiting it "Song of General Kim Il Sung" and the school song in humble reverence for the President, a peerlessly great man.
					
					 After visiting the school Kim Jong Il left at the school his autograph "I wish Yuwen Middle School, which is symbolic of DPRK-China friendship and has a long history and tradition, will train many more excellent personnel. August 26, 2010. Kim Jong Il." 
					
					 Director of the school He Manli said that the long-waited Kim Jong Il's visit not only constitutes the highest glory and pride of the school, a channel of the Sino-DPRK friendship, but also gives precious mental encouragement to them. And the director expressed the determination to keep the Sino-DPRK friendship in bloom generation after generation and wholeheartedly wished him good health.
					
					 The second leg of his visit was the Yaowang Shrine in the Beishan Park, one of the secret places often used by Kim Il Sung in the early days of his revolutionary activities.
					
					 After being briefed on the revolutionary activities of the President at the Yaowang Shrine, Kim Jong Il made the rounds of the basement and main buildings of the shrine where the President had secret meetings. 
					
					 He expressed deep thanks to the party, government and people of China for having greatly valued and preserved and managed the revolutionary relics with much care.
					
					 Then he visited the Jilin Chemical Fiber Group producing a variety of chemical fibers and the building of the Catholic Church in Jilin. He enjoyed a bird's-eye view of Jilin City taking on new appearance. 
					
					  Jilin is a place where he lived before, he said, adding that this time he had an opportunity to witness in this old city great changes and delightful progress and got deep impressions and felt a lot.
					
					 Dai gave a grand banquet in honor of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift prepared by Jilin City with sincerity.
					
					 He visited Changchun City, the seat of Jilin Province.
					
					 He was greeted by Sun Zhengcai, Wang Yulin, Gao Guangbin, Cui Jie and other leading party and government officials of the province and the city.
					
					 He had a cordial talk with Sun Zhengcai.
					
					 Sun warmly welcomed Kim Jong Il on his historic visit, saying that it is the great glory and joy of the province for him to visit the province where many revolutionary relics of Kim Il Sung, a close friend of the Chinese people, are recorded.
					
					 Sun said that Kim Jong Il's visit to China this time is another event of historic significance in the development of the bilateral relations, paying noble tribute to him who is working heart and soul to boost the Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					 Sun highly praised the achievements made by the Korean people in the struggle to open the gate to a thriving nation and introduced the development of Jilin Province.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, conducted by officials from Beijing and leading officials of the province, visited the Changchun Agricultural Expo and the Changchun Rolling Stock Company and commanded a bird's-eye view of Changchun City at night. 
					
					 He highly estimated the good successes made by the Jilin Province and Changchun making rapid progress under the leadership of the Communist Party of China. 
					
					 The Jilin Provincial Committee of the CPC gave a grand banquet in welcome of Kim Jong Il on his visit to the Jilin Province and presented a gift to him.
					
					 He toured Harbin City, the seat of Heilongjiang Province.
					
					 He was greeted at Harbin Railway Station by Ji Bingxuan, secretary of the Heilongjiang Provincial Committee of the CPC, Wang Xiankui, acting governor of Heilongjiang Province, and other leading officials of the party and government of the province and the city. 
					
					 He had a cordial conversation with Ji Bingxuan.
					
					 Ji Bingxuan said that Kim Jong Il's visit to Heilongjiang Province situated on the northernmost tip of northeastern China marks a great auspicious event of the province. He warmly welcomed Kim Jong Il on behalf of all the people of the province.
					
					 The people in the province are rejoiced as over their own over all the achievements made by the fraternal Korean people in the revolution and construction under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, Ji said, wishing them greater success in the building of a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed thanks for the cordial hospitality accorded by leading officials and people of the province.
					
					 He, conducted by Dai Bingguo and other officials from Beijing and leading officials of the province and the city, visited the Harbin Huijiang Foodstuff Company and the Harbin Electrical Group. 
					
					 Saying that Harbin is taking on modern appearance day by day thanks to the creative efforts of the workers and other working people in the city, he congratulated them on the successes made in their efforts.
					
					 The Heilongjiang Provincial Committee of the CPC arranged a grand farewell banquet in honor of Kim Jong Il leaving China after wrapping up his China visit and presented a gift to him.
					
					 He was warmly seen off by Dai Bingguo and leading officials of the province. 
					
					 He acquainted himself in detail with the ideas and feelings of the hard-working and resourceful Chinese people, economy, culture and all other fields, making a long trip to the northeastern region of China.
					
					 He safely returned home amidst the warm send-off of leading officials of the Chinese party and government including Wang Jiarui and Liu Zhijun who guided him with all sincerity in the whole period of his China visit.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's unofficial visit to China was successfully conducted amidst the special concern and cordial hospitality of Hu Jintao and the party and the government of China.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the results of his visit and heartfelt thanks for the cordial hospitality accorded to him by the leading officials of the Chinese party and government and the people in the northeastern region of China.
					
					 His historic China visit will be brilliantly recorded in the history of the DPRK-China friendship as a landmark event of weighty significance in boosting the traditional DPRK-China friendship favorably developing with each passing day.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Thanks to Hu Jintao
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Thanks to Hu Jintao
Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a message of thanks to Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and president of the People's Republic of China, on Monday.
					 The message says:
					
					 Leaving for home after winding up my successful visit to the People's Republic of China, I express deep thanks to you, close comrades of the collective leadership of the CPC and cadres and people of Jilin and Heilongjiang provinces for the warm reception and cordial hospitality accorded to us.
					
					 During our visit to the northeastern region of China where the revolutionaries of the elder generation of the two countries created the history and tradition of the DPRK-China friendship through the bloody struggle against imperialism we more keenly realized how dear the DPRK-Sino friendship is as it is cherished deep in the hearts of the two peoples and weathered all trials of history.
					
					 We were deeply impressed and greatly encouraged to see for ourselves the resourceful and hard-working Chinese people in the region dynamically turning out to display tremendous potential and might under the correct leadership of the CPC. 
					
					 It is my belief that the traditional DPRK-China friendship will as ever grow stronger and develop generation after generation thanks to the joint efforts of the two parties and the two peoples.
					
					 I sincerely hope that the fraternal Chinese people would achieve greater successes in the efforts to build a comprehensively well-off socialist society on the basis of the scientific outlook on development under the leadership of the CPC with you as general secretary and, at the same time, you enjoy good health.

articles.title: Speech of Kim Jong Il at Banquet
articles.content:
Speech of Kim Jong Il at Banquet
Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Following is the speech of General Secretary Kim Jong Il at the banquet:
					 Esteemed Comrade General Secretary Hu Jintao,
					
					 Dear Chinese comrades,
					
					 I am very pleased to visit China again after nearly four months at the warm invitation of you Comrade general secretary and have a significant meeting with you.
					
					 I, above all, would like to express heartfelt thanks to you for having come to Jilin Province, far away from Beijing, to entertain us to this grand banquet and make a friendly speech just before.
					
					 My deep thanks also go to senior officials of national levels and Jilin Province and other Chinese comrades for warmly welcoming us as their own flesh and blood.
					
					 Jilin and Heilongjiang provinces are a witness to Korea-China friendship and a historical land dear to the Korean people as Comrade President Kim Il Sung waged a hard-fought revolutionary struggle against the Japanese imperialists together with Chinese comrades in this area, leaving indelible footsteps.  
					
					 He in his lifetime had often recollected this historical land and wanted to visit here again. Carrying his desire with us, we have come here today.
					
					 Entering the northeastern area of China we have felt that this area, which had been trampled down ruthlessly by the Japanese imperialists, is now vibrant with life, enjoying a splendid development in political, economic, cultural and all other fields under the leadership of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 All the changes the area has undergone go to show that the validity and vitality of the CPC's line and policies have been proved in practice.
					
					 That everything is going well in China, which shares mountain and river with our country, greatly inspires our people in their effort for the cause of socialism and the reunification of the country. 
					
					 We are convinced that the northeastern area of China, including Jilin Province, will as ever make great achievements under the leadership of the CPC headed by you in the effort to build a harmoniously and comprehensive well-off socialist society, by successfully implementing the strategy of the development of the northeastern area on the basis of the viewpoint of scientific development.  
					
					 From the moment we entered this area, where Comrade President Kim Il Sung, together with Chinese revolutionaries of elder generation, fought bloody battles against the Japanese imperialists, even eating and sleeping under the open sky, we have been wrapped in solemn feelings, thinking of traces of blood shed by revolutionary forerunners still gleaming on the crags of Jangbaek and in the stream of Amnok, and keenly felt the valuableness of Korea-China friendship.
					
					 In his youth Comrade President Kim Il Sung fought a hard-fought struggle against the Japanese imperialists here in the northeastern area, breathing air and drinking water in China and, in those days, provided a brilliant history and excellent tradition of unbreakable Korea-China friendship together with Chinese revolutionaries of elder generation.
					
					 With the international situation remaining complicated, it is our important historical mission to hand over to the rising generation the baton of the traditional friendship passed over by the revolutionary forerunners of the two countries as a precious asset so as to carry it forward through generations. 
					
					 Last year we fully demonstrated the solidness and might of the bilateral friendship through events of "Year of Korea-China Friendship".
					
					 In particular, I had significant meetings with you and other leading officials of the Chinese party and reached identity of view in lots of matters in last May, further deepening the political trust and strikingly displaying the invincibility of the bilateral friendship again to the world. 
					
					 Steadily developing the friendship through generations is an important issue in defending peace and security in the Northeast Asia and the rest of the world. 
					
					 It is an unswerving policy of our party and government to further develop through generations and centuries Korea-China friendship, which has overcome all sorts of hardship through history.
					
					 We will as ever make every possible effort to put this friendship on a higher level, true to the noble intention of the revolutionary forerunners of the two countries.

articles.title: Speech of Hu Jintao at Banquet
articles.content:
Speech of Hu Jintao at Banquet
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Following is the speech of Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and president of the People's Republic of China, at the banquet: 
					 Esteemed Comrade General Secretary Kim Jong Il,
					
					 Dear comrades from Korea,
					
					 I, first of all, would like to warmly welcome the China visit of you, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, on behalf of the Chinese party, government and people.
					
					 Your two visits to China in less than four months are enough to show that you have attached a great importance to steadily consolidating and developing the traditional Sino-Korean friendship.
					
					 Just before, we made an in-depth exchange of views in a pleasant and outspoken atmosphere on crucial matters concerning the bilateral relations and those of mutual interests.
					
					 I believe that your current visit will surely mark an important occasion in invigorating exchange and cooperation between the two countries, promoting mutual understanding and trust and further developing the bilateral friendship and cooperation.
					
					 Contained in Sino-Korean friendship are lifelong efforts of the elder-generation revolutionaries of the two countries, the common ideal of socialism and an ardent expectation of the two peoples.
					
					 The Chinese party and government have always set great store by the traditional friendship between the two countries, defended and developed it on a strategic level, and regarded it as an unshakable policy to steadily consolidate and develop the friendship.
					
					 We will strive, together with the Korean comrades, to put the bilateral friendship and cooperation on a higher level in the new century.
					
					 A conference of the WPK will be held in Korea in the first half of September.
					
					 I, on behalf of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, wish a signal success to the WPK conference.
					
					 Korea will celebrate the 65th anniversary of the WPK on October 10.
					
					 Over the past 65 years, the WPK has guided all the Korean people to make tremendous achievements in the socialist revolution and construction.
					
					 We, a friendly neighbor and a close comrade and friend of Korea, sincerely hope that the Korean people under the leadership of the WPK headed by you will greet the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung in 2012 by pursuing a way of development suitable to the conditions of their country and continuing making fresh and greater achievements in the historical course of the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Delegation
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of political officials of the Vietnam People's Army headed by Lieut. General Ngo Xuan Lich, deputy head of the General Political Department, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
					 The head of the delegation said that while visiting several places during his stay, he witnessed the appearance of the DPRK army and people rallied around the Workers' Party of Korea and the leader in single mind and the successes achieved in the building of the economy and national defence. 
					
					 He expressed conviction that the DPRK army and people will achieve greater successes in safeguarding the country and building socialism under the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets King of Malaysia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets King of Malaysia
Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to A1-Wathiqu Billah Tuanku Mizan Zainal Abidin Ibni A1-Marhum Sultan Mahmud Al-Muktafi Billah Shah, King of Malaysia, on the occasion of its national day.
					Sincerely wishing the friendly Malaysian people progress and prosperity, Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger under the care of the King in the future, too.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Malaysian PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Malaysian PM
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Monday sent a message of greetings to Datuk Seri Mohamad Najib Bin Tun Haji Abudul Razak, Prime Minister of Malaysia, on its national day.
					 Wishing the Prime Minister success in his work for the country's prosperity and welfare, the message expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop in all fields of politics, economy and culture in the future.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Malaysian counterpart Datuk Anifah Aman on the same day.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with Malaysian Embassy Held
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting with Malaysian Embassy Held
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with staff members of the Malaysian embassy here took place in Pyongyang on Monday on the national day of Malaysia.
					 Present there on invitation were Rahimi Bin Harun, Malaysian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 On hand were Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as vice-chairman of the DPRK-Malaysia Friendship Association, and officials concerned.
					
					 The participants talked with each other about developing the relations between the DPRK and Malaysia and played sports and amusement games.

articles.title: Meetings of Delegates for WPK Conference Held
articles.content:
Meetings of Delegates for WPK Conference Held
						
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Meetings of delegates of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, the Cabinet and the ministries of Railways and Culture of the Workers' Party of Korea for election of delegates to the WPK conference took place on Aug. 27, according to Rodong Sinmun Monday.
					 Attending the meetings were delegates elected by party organizations of units at different levels of the KPISF, the Cabinet, ministries and national institutions. 
					
					 The meetings discussed the issue of electing delegates to the conference of the WPK. 
					
					 Speeches on the election were made by Ri Pyong Sam, director of the Political Bureau of the KPISF, at the meeting of the KPISF, Choe Yong Rim, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and premier of the Cabinet who is a delegate of the party organization of the Secretariat of the Cabinet, at the meeting of the Cabinet, Han Chang Nam, director of the Political Bureau of the Ministry of Railways who is a delegate of the party organization of the Chongjin Railway Bureau, at the meeting of the Ministry of Railways and Ri Myong Mo, chief secretary of the Party Committee of the Ministry of Culture who is a delegate of the party organization of the unit of the Party Committee of the ministry, at the meeting of the ministry. 
					
					 They said that through his energetic Songun revolutionary leadership Kim Jong Il has fully strengthened the WPK and the army and displayed the dignity and honor of the country and nation of Korea to the world, adding this is an immortal exploit performed by him to shine forever.
					
					 They noted that thanks to the brilliant great leadership of Kim Jong Il the WPK has developed into the great party of President Kim Il Sung remaining boundlessly loyal to his idea and cause as it is today and the experienced political general staff of the Songun revolution and the genuine mother party leading revolution and construction to victory with its outstanding leadership art.
					
					 They courteously proposed the election of Kim Jong Il as a delegate to the conference of the WPK reflecting the unanimous wish of all the officials, party members, public security persons, soldiers and working people.
					
					 Speakers at the meetings unanimously supported and approved this proposal.
					
					 Decisions on electing Kim Jong Il as a delegate to the conference of the WPK were adopted at the meetings with a unanimous approval.
					
					 The meetings also elected delegates to the conference of the WPK.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Immortal Feats for Youth League Held
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Ilâ€™s Immortal Feats for Youth League Held 
Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- A seminar on the immortal feats performed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il in the development of the work of the youth league through his revolutionary activities at Kim Il Sung University took place in the hall of the youth league on Monday.
					 Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and other speakers said that Kim Jong Il's start of his leadership over Kim Il Sung University in Juche 49 (1960) marked a historic event that put the Korean youth movement onto a new higher stage. 
					
					 They noted that he comprehensively clarified the essence and mission of the socialist youth movement and ways to fulfill it, paving the way for developing the Korean youth movement. 
					
					 He comprehensively expounded the idea and theory of the youth movement based on the revolutionary outlook on the leader for the first time in history, providing guidelines for developing the Juche-oriented youth movement, they noted, and went on:
					
					 The young Korean people have grown to be revolutionary and militant ranks which remain loyal to the Songun leadership of the party, glorifying their worthy lives as vanguard fighters devotedly defending the leader. This is entirely thanks to the outstanding and tested leadership of Kim Jong Il, who energetically led the youth league through his revolutionary activities at the university.
					
					 Thanks to his meticulous guidance, the Juche-oriented stand was established in the students' study of subjects, a scientific method of learning introduced and various mass movements for improving study made brisk progress. 
					
					 It is a fundamental guarantee for further strengthening the youth league into the Songun youth organization of the party to add shine to the feats performed by him in leading the youth movement in his university days, the speakers said, underscoring the need for the youth league to carry out its mission and duty.
					
					 Present there were Ri Yong Su, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and officials of the youth league.

articles.title: Stamp-Releasing Ceremony Held
articles.content:
Stamp-Releasing Ceremony Held 
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- A commemorative stamp (a souvenir sheet) was released on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Cuba.
					 The stamp carries a photo of President Kim Il Sung and Fidel Castro Ruz.
					
					 Seen on it are letters reading "Commemorating the 50th anniversary of establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and the Republic of Cuba" and "Juche 49 (1960)-Juche 99 (2010)" and national flags of the two countries.
					
					 A releasing ceremony was held at the Korean Stamp Exhibition Hall on Monday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ho Song Gil, director of the State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK, officials concerned, working people in the city, Ambassador Jose Manuel Galego Montano and staff members of the Cuban embassy here.
					
					 Speakers at the ceremony said that the release of the stamp would mark a historical occasion in demonstrating the firm will of the two parties, armies and peoples to struggle to the last for the victory of the human cause of independence and socialism in the new century, too.
					
					 The participants looked round the commemorative stamps on display showing the friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: New Folktale Book Published
articles.content:
New Folktale Book Published
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Publishing House has of late published a new book "World of Folktales" (two parts).
					 The book gives a deep knowledge of fine and rich folktales by considering and analyzing the long-told tales according to their art and literary features, types and branches.
					
					 Contained in the book are tales classified and selected from history books, collections of works authored by individual writers, unofficial and official historical stories, biographies of master-hands and collections of legends. 
					
					 The book also introduces some pieces of common sense.

articles.content:
AEAK Greets 30th Birthday
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The Art Exchange Association of Korea greets its 30th birthday on Monday.
					 The DPRK government established the Korea Art Performance Association in August 30, Juche 69 (1980), which was reorganized as AEAK in July 1986.
					
					 Its mission is to, through art exchange at home and abroad, contribute to promoting mass cultural and art activities, making cultural and emotional life prevail throughout the society, demonstrating ever-developing Korean arts to the world and intensifying solidarity with other countries.
					
					 Over the last three decades, it has successfully sponsored the April Spring Friendship Art Festival, an international festival, on 26 occasions and the April Spring People's Art Festival, a domestic one, twice to celebrate the birthday of President Kim Il Sung as the greatest holiday of the nation and a significant day of the world.
					
					Since the international festival started in 1982 to celebrate the 70th birthday of the President, it has been participated in by more than 15,800 foreigners and overseas Koreans from different parts of the world.
					
					 AEAK has helped art troupes of the country give performances in many countries, introducing the Juche-oriented arts, and hosted different art events in Korea for foreign guests.
					
					 It has also organized art training courses for overseas Koreans to teach them the excellent arts of the nation.
					
					 It, situated in Central District, Pyongyang, was awarded with the Order of National Flag 1st Class.

articles.title: Japan Held Accountable for Ukishima-maru Incident
articles.content:
Japan Held Accountable for Ukishima-maru Incident
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Sixty-five years has elapsed since thousands of Koreans were killed by the explosion of the Japanese vessel Ukishima-maru on August 24, 1945.
					 The genocide was perpetrated by the Japanese military in a deliberate and premeditated way with the government's approval.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists committed the atrocity to have their revenge on Koreans for their defeat in the war and keep their crimes against them in the dark.
					
					 The vessel was not exploded by a mine as the Japanese government announced but sunken intentionally by the Japanese military.
					
					 It was revealed by the facts that the Koreans' boarding on the vessel and its departure were all planned by the Japanese military at the government's beck and call, that the destination of the vessel was bound for Maizuru Port of Japan, not Pusan of Korea and that Japanese seamen left the vessel by lifeboats before explosion.
					
					 The Japanese government failed to make an investigation into the incident and kept it in secret, totally ignoring the demand of the survivors for opening the incident-related documents to the public.
					
					 Though many years has passed since the massacre, the Korean people have still kept the incident in memory.
					
					 Japan should admit its responsibility for the incident and make an apology and reparation to the families of the victims.

articles.title: Korean Jurists Committee Demands Japan's Settlement of Past History
articles.content:
Korean Jurists Committee Demands Japan's Settlement of Past History
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The Korean Jurists Committee released a white paper Monday to denounce the Japanese reactionaries for evading the settlement of the crime-woven past history while talking about "legitimacy" of the "Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty" even though a century has passed since Japan totally deprived Korea of its state sovereignty by fabricating the "treaty" by force.
					 The "treaty" was illegal in that it was fabricated in a coercive manner by the Japanese imperialists in utter disregard of the procedures to be undergone when concluding an international treaty. The white paper cited facts to prove this. It went on:
					
					 The royal instruction of Emperor Sunjong which announced the "annexation" on August 29, 1910 had only royal seal used for administrative approval but no signature of the emperor. "Royal edict" of the Japanese king promulgated on the same day had both seal and signature.
					
					 The fact that the royal instruction had no signature of the emperor of Korea proves that Emperor Sunjong did not sign the "treaty" in protest against the Japanese imperialists' moves to usurp Korea.
					
					 All these facts go to clearly prove that the "treaty" fabricated by the Japanese imperialist gangsters had neither legality nor validity as it was a fraud document devoid of elementary forms as an international treaty from A to Z.
					
					 Disclosing Japan's persistent "justification" of the "treaty" and its reactionary nature, the white paper went on:
					
					 The successive Japanese governments and reactionary conservative politicians have denied the illegality of the "treaty" even today after the lapse of a century since its fabrication while running whole gamut of sheer sophism to justify the "legality" of the "treaty."
					
					 Japan's attitude and viewpoint on the "treaty" are that the treaty was concluded as valid one from a legal point of view at the time of its conclusion and, therefore, Japan has no legal responsibility for the colonial rule over Korea.
					
					 If the Japanese reactionaries admit their history of crimes, they cannot but assure the international community that they will not repeat such crimes.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries consider doing so as barring them from launching reinvasion.
					
					 Herein lies one of the major reasons why they deny Japan's past history.
					
					 Another aim sought by the Japanese authorities is to evade the legal responsibility to make reparation for the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past.
					
					 The Japanese authorities have gone so impudent as to calculate that they can shirk the responsibility for reparation if they do not admit their history of aggression and plunder.
					
					 If Japan, a member of the international community, evades its legal responsibility and obligation for the hideous crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against humanity in the past, it will only show in the eyes of the world people that it is a lawless state.
					
					 It is a common duty facing not only those countries which were invaded by Japan and people of those counties who suffered from it but all other people of the world to force Japan to admit its past crimes and make reparation for them, not just an issue to be settled between Korea and Japan.  
					
					 Considering that Japan's redemption of its past is not only an issue related to the victims of its aggression and Japan but an issue related to global peace and security, an issue of defending justice and principle of international law, the white paper declared that the committee would join the peace-loving people in Asia and the rest of the world, progressive juristic organizations and jurists in waging a more vigorous just struggle to force Japan to settle its past crimes.

articles.title: US Urged to Drop Cold War-minded Way of Thinking
articles.content:
US Urged to Drop Cold War-minded Way of Thinking 
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- U.S. President Obama recently said that the U.S. remains committed to helping the "security" and "defence" of south Korea and the U.S. secretary of State also talked about the "firm relations of cooperation" between the U.S. and south Korea.
					 The U.S. puts up such spurious signboards as "security" and "defence" whenever it mulls pushing the situation in various regions of the world including south Korea to an acute phase, but with no sophism can it cover up its scenario for aggression, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that nuclear test wars, staged by the U.S. imperialists in recent years after hurling armed forces huge enough to fight a war into the Asia-Pacific region, had nothing to do with "defence".
					
					 The frequent joint military exercises the U.S. staged with south Korea on the Korean Peninsula while crying out for tightened "alliance" is a vivid manifestation of its Cold War-minded way of thinking.
					
					 It is the U.S. scenario to have tighter hold on south Korea and Japan and contain by force the DPRK and countries around it in Northeast Asia.
					
					 The tightened "military alliance" with south Korea touted by the U.S. stemmed from its criminal intention to stifle the DPRK by force of arms and, furthermore, maintain and strengthen the military hegemony in the Asia-Pacific region. 
					
					 It can not but be an anachronistic action for the U.S. to persist in the reckless war moves in collusion with south Korea under the signboard of tightened "alliance."
					
					 The U.S. is well advised not to make military strategic error, well aware of who its rival is. It should drop the anachronistic Cold War-minded way of thinking and stop the reckless military action.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Treacherous Malarkey Denounced
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Treacherous Malarkey Denounced
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak at talks with Obama held on the sidelines of an international meeting in Canada in June reportedly made such shocking remarks that in case the issue of transferring the U.S. military base in Futenma of Japan turns worst, south Korea would like to "host the base."
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a signed commentary in this regard: This is another intolerable act of treachery to serve the U.S. as it is intended to seriously infringe upon the national dignity and sovereignty and unhesitatingly sell off the interests of the nation to outsiders and a reckless action to push the situation on the Korean Peninsula and in its vicinity to an unpredictable catastrophe.
					
					 Lee's offer to bring the "monster-like" U.S. military base rejected even by the Japanese to south Korea cannot be construed otherwise than a treacherous malarkey beyond imagination.
					
					 Even the mere appearance of a U.S. carrier called "floating military base" screws up the military tensions around the Korean Peninsula in a minute and poses a grave threat to the other party. Under this situation it is not hard to guess how adversely the proposed transfer of the U.S. air force base to south Korea from Futenma will affect the military equilibrium and security in Northeast Asia.
					
					  If peace and security are to be ensured on the Korean Peninsula it is urgent to force all the U.S. imperialist aggression troops and their bases to withdraw from south Korea. The Lee group is seeking to host more U.S. military bases in disregard of the stark reality. It is, indeed, a group of wicked enemies of the nation and dangerous war maniacs keen to realize their criminal ambition to do harm to the fellow countrymen by force in collusion with aggressors to please outsiders, toeing their line. 
					
					 The reality calls not only on the south Korean people but on all other Koreans to wage a vigorous nationwide struggle to bring a miserable end to the group of traitors keen to do harm to the nation in reliance upon outsiders.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's "Three-phase Unification Proposal" Snubbed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's "Three-phase Unification Proposal" Snubbed
Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The "three-phase unification proposal" spelled out by traitor Lee Myung Bak is a combination of the "proposal for unifying the Korean community", a separatist proposal made by traitor Roh Tae Woo decades ago, and "no nukes, opening and 3000 dollars", an anti-reunification and confrontational policy of the conservative regime. It is, therefore, nothing but an empty talk devoid of any feasibility as it disregarded the specific reality of the north-south relations and an unreasonable anti-reunification scenario to prevent the June 15 era of reunification from advancing and realize the wild ambition for "unification of systems."
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The "peaceful community", which the Lee group claimed to be the first phase of the above-said proposal, is peppered with hypocritical and preposterous jargons. 
					
					  If durable peace is to be ensured on the Korean Peninsula, the inter-Korean relations should be improved, the DPRK and the United States should conclude a peace treaty, the U.S. forces threatening peace should quit south Korea and an end should be put to arms buildup and exercises for a war of aggression against the DPRK. This is a prerequisite to durable peace on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 But the Lee Myung Bak group raised the "north's dismantlement of nukes" as a precondition for the establishment of "peaceful community", while turning blind eyes to this fundamental issue. This is sheer sophism which can convince no one. 
					
					 Similarly nonsensical is Lee's proposal for building an "economic community" through "comprehensive exchange and cooperation" between the north and the south. 
					
					 Lurking behind this proposal is a sinister intention of the puppet traitor to realize his wild ambition for "unification under liberal democracy" when an opportunity presents itself, regarding  the inter-Koreans as ties between the two different countries and whiling time away with trade.
					
					 It is also sheer sophism for Lee to assert that it is necessary to pull down the "barrier of systems" between the north and the south and head for a "national community".
					
					 The Koreans have the proposal of founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, the most realistic and convincing proposal for reunification based on the three principles --independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity. 
					
					 Growing stronger as the days go by are the faith and will of the Korean nation to achieve independent reunification in accordance with the proposal for founding the DFRK holding high the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration. 
					
					 The puppet group's desperate efforts to realize its wild ambition for achieving "unification of systems" by doing harm to the DPRK in reliance upon foreign forces will get it nowhere.

articles.title: DPRK Hailed by Political Figure of Mexico

					 It said that the founding of the DPRK by President Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea, was a historic event that paved the way of building a unique socialist state centered on the popular masses.
					
					 For more than 60 years after the founding of the DPRK, the Korean people have built a socialist power frustrating the persistent moves of the imperialist allied forces and reactionaries to stifle it, the statement said, adding: The Korean people have grown to be people strong in the sense of independence and the DPRK has turned into a political, ideological and military power nobody can deny or provoke.

Korean People's Struggle Supported in Philippines

					 The statement accused the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet authorities of fabricating the case of the sunken warship "Cheonan" and staged madcap war exercises targeted against the DPRK under that pretext.

					 The organization, standing for the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea, demands the U.S. make compensation for all its crimes committed against the Korean people. It extended full solidarity and support to them led by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Italy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Italy
